attributes.action: Put cameras in Carnegie park BD18
attributes.additional_details: I think it is appalling that children can not walk home or play out safely with their friends these days! I really need people to get behind this to keep our children, siblings and friends safe. My sister is terrified to leave the house or go out with her friends and it shouldn't be this way!There is no way to identify the thugs that did this to my sister but having cameras put up in our local park can make the future safer for everybody.We can let children play without fear of them being harmed
attributes.background: After 9 year old Jason D'arcy was stabbed by nathaniel Flynn in 2013 I am amazed that further courses of protection weren't put into place. Yesterday night (07/04/16) my younger sister (15) was surrounded in Carnegie park by a gang of youths who put a flip knife to her chin.Action needs to be taken!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor
